reporting-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

title.narrative: Acoustic monitoring in the Republic of Congo: establishing expert capacity

description.narrative: Conserve biodiversity and manage natural resources in ways that maintain their long-term viability and preserve their potential to meet the needs of present and future generations. Activities include combating illegal and corrupt exploitation of natural resources and the control of invasive species. Programs in this element should be integrated with the Agriculture Area under Economic Growth and Conflict Mitigation and Reconciliation Area under the Peace and Security Category, when applicable and appropriate.

This award strives to conserve biodiversity and manage natural resources in ways that maintain their long-term viability and preserve their potential to meet the needs of present and future generations. Activities include combating illegal and corrupt exploitation of natural resources and the control of invasive species. This includes This project supports capacity development at The Cornell Elephant Listening Project for an advanced field biologist, Mr. Clement Inkamba-Nkulu of the Republic of Congo. It will enhance his expertise on acoustic monitoring tools for elephant conservation. The project is intended to conserve forest elephants by improving the ability to track changes in elephant activity in dense forested landscapes, estimate population density and quantify human activities such as hunting and their impact on elephant movements and behavior. Specific activities include: 1) providing in-depth training in sound analysis and visualization; 2) ensuring a level of training that enables independent acoustic monitoirng research and the ability to train other field biologists and technicians in these skills; and 3) analyzing archived acoustic data and preparing a manuscript that interprets these results..

participating-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

participating-org.usg:office-name: Fish and Wildlife Service/Office of International Affairs

owner-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

description.narrative: U.S. assistance to the Republic of the Congo (Congo) focuses on promoting regional peace and security in this post-conflict country. Boasting Central Africa's only deep water port, the Congo's financial capital of Pointe-Noire maintains its International Ship and Port Facility Security (ISPS) certification. This certification creates significant economic opportunity for the Congo - which seeks to turn the coastal city into a regional shipping hub - while requiring a modern, professional security posture in accordance with strict ISPS standards. To help promote this growth and encourage regional stability, U.S. foreign assistance focuses on development of the Congo's professional military capabilities and provides foundational training for development in this area, in keeping with post's Integrated Country Strategy.
